input_text:
Job Title: Program Manager

Location: Boise, ID

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
We are hiring Program Manager for one of our client. Details mentioned below :
Purpose
As a Program Manager of highly technical engineers, you will be responsible for working with the technical team to develop plans and coordinate executing the plans to achieve innovative deliveries on time and within budget. Your involvement will play a key role in creating a streamlined, organized, and positive experience for our customers and employees. You will report to company leadership and interact and support team members across the organization.
You will:- Develop Program Plans:In coordination with the project technical lead(s), define project objectives, project scope, roles & responsibilities based on the contract, the proposal and company objectivesDefine resource and technical requirements and manage resource availability & allocationPrepare a detailed project plan to schedule key project milestones, work streams & activitiesOutline a budget based on requirements and track costs to deliver project on budget- Lead Program Execution:Managing delivery of the project according to the program plan and the contractTrack project and provide regular reports on project status to project team and key internal and external stakeholdersManage and adjust for any changes in project scope, schedule and/or budgetIdentifying and mitigating potential risksManage the relationship and communication with the customer and all stakeholders, ensuring the project is delivered to their satisfaction- Provide input to proposals led by Business Development- Support Business Operations:Organization and execution of company activities including project weekly synch meetings, monthly scheduling, and project updatesInvoice tracking and reconciliation of internal systems, and ensuring accurate billing with internal systemsVarious administrative tasks such as tracking company expenses, subscription management and overseeing asset inventory and general business management- Input to corporate strategy and compliance
Your Experience:A Bachelor’s degree in a relavent field.Ability to obtain a security clearanceMore than 5 years of proven project/program management in past performanceFederal Government contracting and compliance experience strongly preferredExperience working with a range of highly technical engineers and motivate / lead them to achieve their maximum potential on project tasksAbility to clearly capture complex technical concepts in writing and slides for both technical and general audiencesMust have high attention to detail and have experience interfacing directly with DOD customersExperience leading a team of technical subject matter expertsAbility to work independently in a fast-paced environment, while engaging in multiple tasks at onceStrong listening and problem-solving skills
Preferred Qualifications & Experience:Familiar with the components of a Program Protection Plan and the basic principles of each embedded security discipline (anti-tamper, cybersecurity, supply chain security)Experience with EVMS systems for government contract managementExperience with software assurance, system integrity, trust strategies, supply chain exploitation methods and countermeasures and/or general vulnerability analysisTechnical Degree in engineering, computer science, physics or related fieldPMP certification is desired but not a requirement. Should be at least comfortable with all of the standard PMI processes and practicesExperience managing programs using a range of approaches including traditional waterfall and agile approaches

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Program Manager
output_json.summary: Hiring Program Manager for a client in Boise, ID.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
optional_skills: Ability to obtain a security clearance
Federal Government contracting and compliance experience
Experience working with a range of highly technical engineers
Ability to clearly capture complex technical concepts
Experience interfacing directly with DOD customers
Experience leading a team of technical subject matter experts
